snippet: After the failure of Kabul Bank, which investigators have described as a Ponzi scheme, two top executives were given five-year sentences, and others were convicted of a range of crimes.
abstract: Kabul bank founder Sherkham Farnood and Khalilullah Frozi, his chief executive and former bodyguard, are convicted of crime akin to fraud, sentenced to five years in prison and fined hundreds of millions of dollars for bank collapse that investigators have described as result of Ponzi scheme.

byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed, Habib Zahori and Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After the failure of Kabul Bank, which investigators have described as a Ponzi scheme, two top executives were given five-year sentences, and others were convicted of a range of crimes.

headline.seo: Afghan Court Convicts 21 in Kabul Bank Scandal
headline.main: Trail of Fraud and Vengeance Leads to Kabul Bank Convictions
